column4: Hi all. Does anyone know where I can get the man pages for socket programming. eg "man bind","man listen"
manpages-dev
I told the info pages are better for beginners and people who need more extensive docs than just a list of function calls and params.
Thanks. Where would I find the info pages?
There are various prism54 chips and not all are supported the same way.
sudo apt-get install build-essential
thanks a lot :-)
Why does gcc-3.4 not have a dependency on build-essential?
Coz userspace isn't built with gcc 3.4
it's assumed that people who want to build a kernel can read docs ;-)
Userspace binaries build with gcc-4.0?
Indeed.
Any idea why I can't update cc using update-alternatives?
Installing unpackaged python stuff isn't  agreat idea.
Why not
What happens when an upgraded package tries to write a file that suddenly already exists?
Unfortunetly, I'm not left with much choice, since the current version of the module that I want to use is somewhat broken.
Which python are you using? 2.3? There may be a python-2.4 package.
No I'm using python 2.4
ah ok
Well I found a workaround :-) Just copy the new package files into the same directory as your script and it will use that package instead of the system package. Anyways thanks for your help.
neet :-)
